body_content.explanation: showing the belief that people from a particular generation (= a group of people born during the same period of time) share particular characteristics that make them different from, especially better or worse than, other generations:
examples: Generationalist thinking is persistent in its popularity.
His opinion that the journal should not publish writers aged over 45 is as ridiculous as any generationalist argument.

body_content.explanation: a person who believes that people from a particular generation (= a group of people born during the same period of time) share particular characteristics that make them different from, especially better or worse than, other generations:
examples: Generationalists are likely to treat members of different generations differently, creating a self-fulfilling prophecy.
